reviews.review_msg: Kathleens 303 course was frustrating due to subjective grading, unclear criteria, and inconsistent evaluation. Excessive readings and content left little room for meaningful engagement or reflection. Creative solutions were dismissed with comments like, “This isn't Disneyland,” discouraging critical thinking. Overall, the course felt discouraging.
Terrible grading

Although Kathleen's lectures are engaging and the content is good, her grading and the overall work structure for her class is terrible. I've never seen a class where work is so subjectively graded. All her feedback along with her TA's is very opinionated, far from objective, and at times even contradictory.

Kathleen is a really good professor, she cares about you and gives you lots of practice before assessments. Her feedback is always detailed, and she explains her grading well. If you attend all classes and pay attention to her feedback, you will do well.

This class should be taken off from the reqs. It is literally bus272, just more group work. So repetitive, and purposeless. She was so boring but was quite unfair with marks. Did not highlight what she expected from you. I truly think that this class should not be paid for, and not worth the time.

I understand that mandatory attendance and heavy reliance on group projects may just not be for some people. But if you can handle it, take 303 with Kathleen. She is clearly very passionate on what she teaches, makes sure everyone gets more than enough feedback for every assignment. She gives you all the tools to succeed, you just gotta show up.

Kathleen's course is primarily in-class, with little homework and no slide postings. While she provides engaging lectures with group activities, her grading is tough and includes feedback on all submissions. However, her teaching style may not be suitable for international students or those who have difficulty focusing in class.

You can tell she likes teaching this course but slides should have been uploaded on canvas regardless. But many people won't come for this class if the slides are uploaded and this class has a A LOT of group work. Groups won't work without people so I understand why she doesn't upload the slides. Good prof, weird course. Ethics are imp but not fun

A lot of group work and all assignments are written in class. She didn't upload any slides, so you must copy each slide yourself and do a lot of readings every week. If you don't like working with a group or are not good at writing, never take this course as you would work in a group for 70% of class time. Kathleen is nice but the course is tough.

Kathleen is nice but her BUS303 is horrible. It takes you 2/3 of class time to discuss with team members each class. Kathleen never posts any slides so you should take all notes by yourself. All assignments are in-class and must be hand-writing, and a lot of reading every week. If you don't like teamwork or are not good at writing, never take it.
I didn't learn anything from this course. The grading was extremely tough. How can ethics be so technical? I will never apply a single concept from this class in real life.

Kathleen is very nice however I didn't agree with the way she taught business ethics. The class was very lecture-heavy with some teamwork. She was a very tough grader considering this is a business ethics class which shouldn't have been. Didn't learn much from this class.

Honestly Kathleen formatted this course in the best possible way. I highly recommend taking this class with her. It is extremely stress free and you actually learn in-class with minimal outside homework. I think the other reviews were negative due to the online format of the course. I think since then she has made some major adaptations.

Kathleen is a great prof! You learn by experience in her class. She rarely has work outside class, just simple weekly readings. Theres no tests so you can just focus on reading the (free!) textbook readings to allow yourself to actually learn and grow. Did horribly on the team stakeholder assignment and still pulled through with an A.
Not much work outside of lecture. Very passionate about course content

I didn't learn anything. It was more effective trying to write what they wanted to hear than to learn. Don't have a different opinion and don't use logic in your assignments and you'll do well. Also, she expects us to remember (i.e., tests) the small stuff like specific to the story detail rather than the big picture take away or moral of the story

I wish I went to see her in office hours more, because Kathleen is extremely supportive, approachable, helpful and she gives excellent explanations if something is unclear. The course isn't difficult in course load, but the midterms, and quizzes are tricky, so you must do the readings carefully. She doesn't post slides.

Kathleen is super approachable and passionate about business ethics. She explains concepts well with lots of examples, and provides many opportunities for practice before in-class group assignments. Also, she had a solid plan to alter the class requirements as we transitioned to online learning during the pandemic, alleviating stress.

Kathleen Burke is an amazing prof and business ethics is a super important class for all business students. She provides a super encouraging and welcoming environment to participate in class discussion to explore the ethical situations that business students may face in the future. Love her.

I honestly enjoyed BUS 303 with Kathleen. The readings were relatable and interesting for the course. Kathleen captivates you with a lot of enthusiasm in her lecture. You can't blame Kathleen for having a bad team. She is super approachable and helpful, so you can discuss any of your concerns.

Ridiculous class. Grading schemes are unfair and there is a lot of weight put on team-based work (good luck if you get a bad team). Kathleen tries to make this class as serious as possible and puts up an unrealistically high expectation on her students. Expect strict grading, many assignments and difficult projects!

Class is terrible, but Kathleen makes it much better. She is extremely passionate and provides lots of help to students. She gives 2 practice sessions before the stakeholder analysis as well as gives small ungraded assignments to make everyone comfortable at the midterm. She is a really nice lady

The most useless business class you will ever take at SFU. She does not give clear instructions or expectations for assignments and marks are completely subjective. The extent of her teaching is putting up quotes on lecture slides. You can show up to every class, do all the readings an still not know what it is exactly you are learning about.
Got in to a team everyone trash talked a lot and since I did not talk much, I did not have high grades on participation. If you dont like discussion then dont take this prof. Got an F with 59% (

Taking BUS 303 with Kathleen has been the best decision of my undergrad. I loved taking this class with her- she made lectures go by so fast. I'd recommend taking this class with her. Easy A if you show up and participate in class

Found this class challenging but not in terms of the material taught. The grading scheme is relatively vague and marking on the speak up quizzes seemed subjective. That being said if you can ace the midterm, the presentation and the reflection you should get a good grade even if you're stuck with a bad group.

Best professor I have had in university. Incredibly caring, knowledgeable, receptive and passionate. ALl in all a great teacher. Group assignments and presentation makes up a lot of your grade. I had a phenomenal group that was social as well as high performing. I had a blast going to class and participating. know all the readings!! Have fun!!
Still merely a  business decision, sorry.
It is strict on mark  and unclear instruction on how to work on the assignment and exam .
Nice lady, horrible course. I wish I had dropped it when I could of.

One of those courses that makes you question why you are getting a business degree. Horrible class structure. Participation is marked so you have a lot of students expressing ridiculous and out-of-context opinions. Excruciatingly boring course and feels very expensive! However, Kathleen herself seems like a nice lady and tries her best.

The most disgusting course I've had the displeasure of taking. Dreaded attending that class everytime. This course should not be mandatory under any regard. It's ridiculous we have to take such a mundane course. I can firmly say it's a 9/10 ratio of students who hate this course and learn nothing from it. Thankfully the nightmare is over. Thank god

Excellent lecturer, her classes were always interesting. Workload was totally manageable (Intersession), grading was fair. Doesn't provide copies of slides, doesn't record lectures and forbids recording/photographing, so be prepared for a lot of writing as the slide content is important for assignments and the exam. Lecture gives essentials to pass

Kathleen is a hit or miss professor. For me at least, it was definitely a miss. A big strike out. I literally had depression going to her class, but she is passionate about ethics and if you're keen on short stories and immersing yourself in the world of ethics, she is your best bet. Preparing in advance is the best advice I can give. God bless.

Kathleen is an awesome prof. I lucked out with an amazing group, and my grade seemed to reflect that. Midterm was pretty ambiguous, as she expects you to apply knowledge to scenarios versus simply answering a right/wrong answer.  Answer a question each class and youre in the clear! Would definitely take it with her again.

Attending class is mandatory as participation is important for your mark. This class also relies a ton on your group, so hope that you get assigned to a group that is strong. Take notes in class as she doesn't post lecture slides. Mid-term was easy and the class was overall fun as it required a different level of problem solving thinking.

I admire Kathleen's passion in business ethics. You'll be reading fictions and watching some videos for homework, which can sometimes be long. I recommend reading them before class, so you can quickly review them for the midterm. Participation and teamwork matters, so be engaged in class. Best part: NO Final! I'm enjoying this class with Kathleen!

Quite possibly the easiest business class ever taken. There's 2 *IN-CLASS* group projects, yes, in-class, meaning no hw for either of them. 1 paper reflecting on your performance of one of the projects. 1 exam. Simply based on her lecture notes and examples. Participate. Very easy course. Makes a very dry subject atleast half-interesting.

Kathleen's course was fair, I didn't do most of the readings and hardly took notes in class. However, I showed up, listened and participated in asking questions and answering her questions. I may also have lucked out with a pretty good group as well so your group definitely matters. Oh ya I also went to mexico mid term and still came out with A-

This class felt quite preachy. Kathleen will put a number of irrelevant quotes on the board and expect you to be inspired. She is quite passionate about ethics, but there is not much course content that is applicable for students in business. The marking scheme is also quite vague and subjective in terms of what is a right or wrong response.

Attending class is extremely mandatory. You won't be provided notes other than the ones you take. Her exams are easy ONLY if you review your class notes. Going back to class notes she tells you in lecture what to write, if you can go home and review the notes for exams expect yourself to get a good mark. She's an amazing professor.

This course has valuable takeaway information. However, Kathleen's class requires working with a team of 4-6 members throughout the entire course. The midterm is tricky. To do well you must come to lectures and takes notes in class. Follow her specific grading criteria, participate in class, and do well on the final paper to do well.

Interesting topics but hard to know what is expected on the exam, it's very hard to break away from the class average since most of the grading is related to group work. I suggest taking this class with another prof.

She has lots of material needed to be read which is useless, caz she only test very small part of them. She speaks so fast during class, and sometimes you even do not know what's going on. Her midterm is kind of ridiculous, and you have no idea about how to prepare for the exams. DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE.
This course was ok. It was super hard to know what was expected of you AND way too much of your mark relies on your group in class The work load is manageable though.
Kathleen is a nice professor, but she does not have clear instructions on what she expects from the assignments which can be a big problem. Her TA is willing to help students but grades very harshly.

There is no lecture slides.But she speaks fast and you can't make notes immediately. There are a lot of assignments that i think are useless. If you want to get a good grade, avoid her or you will get sadness.

Kathleen is a great prof. She is  genuinely interested in ethics and the team based group work is awesome. Kathleen likes to challenge her students and lots of class questions are encouraged. Assignments and exams were fair, but make sure you stay up to date on the material or else this class will creep up on you very quick.

Don't take business ethics if you don't need it to graduate. This class is a joke and is completely useless. What we learn in this class has absolutely no correlation with the real world. Are you really going to use ethical theories for making decisions? NO.. you're going to do what you feel is right.
Not clear what she expects in the assignments and presentations. Unstructured lecture.

extremely humble and engaging prof. best business professor i've had so far. as long as you do the readings (book is very engaging) you will do great in this class. a lot of group work which really builds your interpersonal skills. great teacher
Great class.  She really promotes critical thinking.

Best prof ever. She is super poetic and engaging, and even if I hadn't gotten a decent mark in the class, I wouldn't have minded. What I got out of it was useful towards building character. The way her energy takes command of the room while she lectures is impressive. I wish we had more profs like her.

Hated this class.Class average is too high. Her lecture notes are only a few words. She tends to speak fast that it was impossible to write down the lecture notes and listen to her at the same time. Makes us read hundreds of pages of worthless material, which barely gets mentioned on the midterm. If you care about your grades, stay away from her.

Class average for all assignments and midterms are unusually high. This is a nightmare for any business student. I predict that the class average is 78% based on all the assignments. And the presentation is marked by other business students. Reflections are impossible to get perfect and assignment instructions are vague. She cut 30 min on the mt.

Kathleen is a teriffic professor. What I expected to be a boring fluff class was anything but. She is very engaging, supportive and friendly. Very few teachers have impacted me to the extent that she has.

Very bad class. She gives only 75 min to complete the exam. This class is hard and requires you to think quickly and critically. Honestly, you don't even need to read the textbook because 70% of the test requires your to analyze a case. And to make this class worse, she assigns an 8 member group project which gets marked by your peers.
Best prof I've had at SFU by far... very motivating and she makes a big effort to get to know her students - I would recommend her Ethics class to anyone

Amazing prof! Logic and arguments are very compelling. Requires you to think critically on your feet. Lectures are long but very informative. Topics can be dry but she tries her best to make it interesting with relatable stories. Very useful words and very practical course.
SHE IS AMAZING! The lecture was interesting and helpful, and midterm was based on lecture notes.You will do very well if you attend every lecture. I love this woman.

Lectures are disorganized and ambiguous. The exams require an extensive knowledge of the textbook and lecture slides are not posted so be sure to read and attend class if you want a good grade. Marking scheme was unclear. TA wasn't that helpful either.
Lectures are somewhat disorganized. Midterm and final require extensive knowledge of the textbook, and Burke barely covers the textbook content in lecture.

Is a very knowledgeable teacher. She knows her stuff, however, there is limited powerpoint and it gets tough to keep up with the notes. Course materials are needed but not for the tests. Her short answer questions only require a brief amount of information. MC and T/F questions are hard and require in depth knowledge.

She's a pretty nice prof and seems to really know her stuff. However, her lectures are really disorganized and it's really hard to take notes in her class. Her mt and final are pretty easy though, but again, because of the lack of notes, it makes it kind of hard to study

A very knowledgeable and passionate teacher. However, her lectures utilize very little powerpoint and her speed makes it very hard to keep up. Her exams are quite difficult and she refuses to scale even when the best mark from 100 students was a A-(86%). If you want to learn something, take this class, if you want an A, go to douglas.

Nice lady and knows her stuff. She's a bit hard on marking and her exams are challenging. Her exams are based on her lecture so you must attend all classes. Her marking scheme is based on the following: presentation midterm participation essay and final. Overall this class requires your full effort and commitment.
